item.title: 'Now She's Martha, then She's Mary': The Influence of Beguinages on Attitudes Toward Women
item.description: This papers shows the long lasting effects on gender equality the beguine movement had. Beguinages were female-only, semi-religious institutions that appeared in the Low Countries during the Middle Ages. We find that in Belgian municipalities that had a beguinage, the female-to-male wage ratio and literace rates were more similar during the 19th century.
